Detailed Description

This class is the basic container class for UI elements.

A layer is a container for widgets and other UI elements that are visable.

Definition at line 82 of file uilayer.h.

Gorilla::Layer *  GLayer,
Gorilla::Screen *  GScreen 
)

Internal constructor.

Parameters:
name The name of this layer.
GLayer The Gorilla Layer this Layer is based on.
GScreen The gorilla parent screen to this layer.

Definition at line 64 of file uilayer.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

UI::Button * phys::UILayer::CheckButtonMouseIsOver (  ) 

Gets the button the mouse is over if any.

This function searches only the buttons contained in this layer.

Returns:
Returns the button the mouse is over, or NULL if there are none.

UI::Button * phys::UILayer::CreateButton ( ConstString &  Name,
Vector2  Position,
Vector2  Size 
)

Creates a button within this layer.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created button.
Parameters:
Name The name of the button.
Position The top left position of the button.
Size The size of the Button.

UI::Caption * phys::UILayer::CreateCaption ( ConstString &  Name,
Vector2  Position,
Vector2  Size,
Whole  Glyph,
String  Text 
)

Creates a caption within this layer.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created caption.
Parameters:
Name The name of this caption.
Position The top left position of the caption.
Size The size of the Button.
Glyph One of the glyphs specified in your gorilla file. Must be valid.
Text Any text you want printed on the caption.

Definition at line 218 of file uilayer.cpp.

UI::CheckBox * phys::UILayer::CreateCheckBox ( ConstString &  Name,
Vector2  Position,
Vector2  Size,
Whole  Glyph,
String &  LabelText 
)

Creates a CheckBox within this layer.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created CheckBox.
Parameters:
Name The name of the CheckBox.
Position The top left position of the CheckBox.
Size The size of the CheckBox.
Glyph The glyphs to use by default for use with the label. Glyphs are defined in your .gorilla file.
LabelText The text to display with the label. The label uses the Markup Text class, and thus it's light markup text language. You can also pass in a blank string if you don't wish to have a label, you can create a label after construction.

Definition at line 440 of file uilayer.cpp.

UI::Rectangle * phys::UILayer::CreateRectangle ( Vector2  Position,
Vector2  Size 
)

Creates a rectangle within this layer.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
Rectangles are innately put behind all captions, so z-order is not necessary.

Parameters:
Position The top left position of the button.
Size The size of the Button.
